title: 115_hr2490
content: The "Working Students Act" increases support for working students by 35 percent. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to include income protection allowances for dependent and independent students for the academic year 2018-2019. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to include income protection allowances for independent students with dependents other than a spouse for the academic year 2018-2019. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to include income protection allowances for independent students with dependents other than a spouse for the academic year 2018-2019. The income protection allowance for families with different sizes and number of college students is provided, with specific amounts listed for each scenario. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to include income protection allowances for independent students with dependents other than a spouse for the academic year 2018-2019. Specific income protection allowances are provided for families with different sizes and number of college students, with detailed amounts listed for each scenario. Additional amounts can be added for each dependent. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to include updated tables of income protection allowances for independent students starting from the academic year 2018-2019. The Secretary will publish revised tables in the Federal Register, with specific dollar amounts for different scenarios and dependents. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to update income protection allowances for independent students starting from the academic year 2018-2019. The dollar amounts in the table will be adjusted annually based on the Consumer Price Index percentage increase. The amendments to the Higher Education Act of 1965 update income protection allowances for independent students starting from the 2018-2019 academic year. The adjustments will be based on the Consumer Price Index percentage increase, effective July 1, 2018.
